verses.kjv: Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.
verses.ct: So Job, please listen to what I have to say, and pay attention to every word.

verses.kjv: Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.
verses.ct: I'm ready now — I've opened my mouth and my tongue is prepared to speak.

verses.kjv: My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.
verses.ct: What I say comes from an honest heart, and my lips will share knowledge sincerely.

verses.kjv: The spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.
verses.ct: The spirit of God has made me, and the breath of the Almighty has given me life.

verses.kjv: If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me, stand up.
verses.ct: If you can respond to me, then organize your arguments and take your stand.

verses.kjv: Behold, I am according to thy wish in God’s stead: I also am formed out of the clay.
verses.ct: Look, I stand before God just as you wished — I too was formed from clay.

verses.kjv: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.
verses.ct: You don't need to be terrified of me, and I won't pressure you with my authority.

verses.kjv: Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,
verses.ct: You've certainly said this in my hearing — I caught every word clearly:

verses.kjv: I am clean without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.
verses.ct: 'I am pure and free from wrongdoing, I am innocent; there is no guilt in me.

verses.kjv: Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,
verses.ct: Yet God invents reasons to oppose me; he treats me as his enemy.

verses.kjv: He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.
verses.ct: He locks my feet in shackles and watches my every move.'

verses.kjv: Behold, in this thou art not just: I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.
verses.ct: But in this you are wrong. Let me tell you — God is far greater than any human being.

verses.kjv: Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters.
verses.ct: Why do you argue against him? He doesn't have to explain any of his actions.

verses.kjv: For God speaketh once, yea twice, yet man perceiveth it not.
verses.ct: God does speak — once, even twice — but people don't recognize it.

verses.kjv: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;
verses.ct: In a dream, in a nighttime vision, when deep sleep falls over people as they lie in bed,

verses.kjv: Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,
verses.ct: that's when he opens their ears and confirms his warnings to them,

verses.kjv: That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man.
verses.ct: so that he can turn a person away from wrong actions and strip away their pride.

verses.kjv: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.
verses.ct: He holds their soul back from the pit and keeps their life from destruction by the sword.

verses.kjv: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain:
verses.ct: A person may also be disciplined through pain on their sickbed, with constant agony in their bones,

verses.kjv: So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat.
verses.ct: until they can't stand the thought of food, and even the finest meals disgust them.

verses.kjv: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.
verses.ct: Their body wastes away until it's barely visible, and bones that were once hidden now protrude.

verses.kjv: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the grave, and his life to the destroyers.
verses.ct: Their soul approaches the grave, and their life draws near to death.

verses.kjv: If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man his uprightness:
verses.ct: But if an angel comes alongside them — a mediator, one out of a thousand — to reveal to that person what is right,

verses.kjv: Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.
verses.ct: then God shows mercy and says, 'Rescue this person from going down to the pit — I have found a ransom for them.'

verses.kjv: His flesh shall be fresher than a child’s: he shall return to the days of his youth:
verses.ct: Their body will become healthier than a child's; they will be restored to the strength of their youth.

verses.kjv: He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.
verses.ct: They will pray to God, and he will accept them favorably. They will come into his presence with joy, because he restores that person's righteousness.

verses.kjv: He looketh upon men, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not;
verses.ct: That person will declare to others, 'I sinned and twisted what was right, but I didn't get what I deserved.

verses.kjv: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.
verses.ct: God rescued my soul from going into the pit, and my life will enjoy the light.'

verses.kjv: Lo, all these things worketh God oftentimes with man,
verses.ct: Pay attention — God does all these things for a person, again and again,

verses.kjv: To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.
verses.ct: to pull their soul back from the pit, so they can be filled with the light of the living.

verses.kjv: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.
verses.ct: Listen carefully, Job — pay attention to me. Stay quiet, and let me speak.

verses.kjv: If thou hast anything to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.
verses.ct: If you have something to say, then answer me. Go ahead and speak, because I genuinely want to see you proven right.

verses.kjv: If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
verses.ct: But if not, then listen to me. Stay quiet, and I will teach you wisdom.
